originalText.text: WOW - These guys were incredible, and I would highly recommend them. The booking process was easy, they responded immediately to my son’s emails and answered all his questions to put his mind at ease. The carriage and “Trigger” the horse was decorated beautifully, the driver, private photographer and videographer were an amazing team, they went above and beyond to truly make this a special experience for them.

The booking process was easy, they responded immediately to my son’s emails and answered all his questions to put his mind at ease. The carriage and “Trigger” the horse was decorated beautifully, the driver, private photographer and videographer were an amazing team, they went above and beyond to truly make this a special experience for them.

originalText.text: My wife and I loved the tour Horse Carriage Central Park. The driver was fantastic, professional, knowledgeable. Even though it was raining the tour was accommodating and worth it. I'd do it again when in NY.

text.text: My wife and I loved the tour Horse Carriage Central Park. The driver was fantastic, professional, knowledgeable. Even though it was raining the tour was accommodating and worth it. I'd do it again when in NY.

originalText.text: Booked ahead of time to make sure there was availability because it was my better half’s first time to NYC and wanted a Christmas Eve horse and carriage ride in Central Park. Did the VIP tour for 60 minutes with three stops to get out and walk around. At the first stop our guy Ismael said you can get out if you want for 10 minutes or we can keep going. The other two stops whatever they were we did not know or get out. Tour ended in 45 minutes when I inquired that it was an hour tour he said (as we are already packed and off the carriage) his horse is faster than the rest but we can get back on and go more. Lastly the price paid was double what there were onsite. I get the booking agency gets a fee but well over $300 for a 45 minute ride with one stop - 3 stars is generous

text.text: Booked ahead of time to make sure there was availability because it was my better half’s first time to NYC and wanted a Christmas Eve horse and carriage ride in Central Park. Did the VIP tour for 60 minutes with three stops to get out and walk around. At the first stop our guy Ismael said you can get out if you want for 10 minutes or we can keep going. The other two stops whatever they were we did not know or get out. Tour ended in 45 minutes when I inquired that it was an hour tour he said (as we are already packed and off the carriage) his horse is faster than the rest but we can get back on and go more. Lastly the price paid was double what there were onsite. I get the booking agency gets a fee but well over $300 for a 45 minute ride with one stop - 3 stars is generous

originalText.text: The carriage was super cute and our driver was great. I wish It went a little further into the park, but overall we enjoyed our carriage ride. I was disappointed to see I paid Nearly double by booking it ahead of time. I would Recommend just going to Central Park and getting a carriage. this same carriage took people without reservations and had significantly different prices posted.

originalText.text: This tour was absolutely incredible. I felt like Cinderella. Our driver was so funny and knowledgeable. He was definitely a professional. Made sure we knew where to meet and provide us nice cozy blankets. We really enjoyed the occasion and highly recommended.
